text: Can a python program be sent to a computer without python and be ran?
Hey, I was wanting to know if I can make a python program and send it to a remote computer and have it ran without that computer having python.
I've heard you can't as it needs to be interrpreted.
If this is true then it seems very odd as it would be hard to distribute your program unless everyone decides to install Python.
Also, what about C and C++?
Can they be ran on a remote computer without having the language program installed?
So far I think you can since it is a compiled language.
But I'm not exactly sure and would like clarification.
EDIT: I'm getting some mixed answers on this.
So I'm not sure where to go.
I see that I can include the Python library in the program and I can use py2exe
However, I'm confused on C and C++.
Do I have to include their libraries in the program?
Can they only be ran on certain machines?
Does the compiler allow it to run on all machines?
